sites.name: The Golden Roof (Goldenes Dachl)
sites.description: A landmark in Innsbruck, the Golden Roof is a late Gothic oriel with a roof covered with 2,738 fire-gilded copper tiles.
sites.seasonal_notes: Visible year-round from the outside.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours available for related museum.

sites.name: Hofburg Palace
sites.description: Once the residence of the Tyrolean sovereigns, this palace is a remarkable example of Baroque architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; consider seasonal exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Consider buying tickets online to skip the queue.

sites.name: Bergisel Ski Jump
sites.description: A modern architectural marvel offering panoramic views of Innsbruck and the surrounding mountains.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for ski jumping events or training schedules.
sites.booking_tips: Combine your visit with a tour of the surrounding Olympic venues.

sites.name: Tyrolean State Museum (Ferdinandeum)
sites.description: Explore Tyrolean art and history from prehistoric times to the present at this comprehensive museum.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for temporary exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Check for temporary exhibitions and special events.

sites.name: Innsbruck Cathedral (Dom zu St. Jakob)
sites.description: A stunning Baroque cathedral known for its impressive ceiling frescoes and opulent altar.
sites.seasonal_notes: Respect service times if visiting.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours are available; check times in advance.

sites.name: Swarovski Crystal Worlds
sites.description: A magical experience showcasing the brilliance of crystal in a series of artistic installations. Located slightly outside Innsbruck in Wattens.
sites.seasonal_notes: Garden installations may vary by season.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online for discounts and express entry. Consider the shuttle bus from Innsbruck.

sites.name: Nordkette Cable Car
sites.description: Take the cable car from Innsbruck to the top of the Nordkette for stunning views over the city and mountains.
sites.seasonal_notes: Weather dependent; check conditions before going up. Hiking options available in summer.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be bought at the station or online. Consider Innsbruck Card for potential discounts.

sites.name: Tyrolean Folk Art Museum
sites.description: Discover a rich collection of Tyrolean cultural artifacts, from traditional costumes to handmade objects.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for special exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Check for guided tours and special exhibitions. Can be combined with Hofkirche ticket.

sites.name: Alpenzoo Innsbruck
sites.description: Europe's highest-altitude zoo featuring alpine animals including bears, wolves, ibex, and eagles in naturalistic habitats.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round, but animals are more active in spring and fall.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online; consider combining with the Hungerburgbahn funicular for easy access.

sites.name: Court Church (Hofkirche)
sites.description: Gothic church housing the impressive cenotaph of Emperor Maximilian I, surrounded by 28 bronze statues of his ancestors and heroes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded in winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Combined ticket available with Folk Art Museum. Audio guides recommended.

sites.name: Ambras Castle
sites.description: Renaissance castle with beautiful gardens, featuring a notable collection of armor, art, and curiosities collected by Archduke Ferdinand II.
sites.seasonal_notes: Gardens best visited in summer; castle open year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Spend time in both the Upper and Lower Castle. Audio guides available.

sites.name: Maria-Theresien-Straße
sites.description: Innsbruck's elegant main street with impressive Baroque and Rococo buildings, upscale shops, cafes, and the iconic Annasäule (St. Anne's Column).
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful Christmas markets in winter; outdoor cafes in summer.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Great for photos with mountain backdrop.

sites.name: Triumphal Arch (Triumphpforte)
sites.description: Historic marble arch built in 1765 to commemorate the marriage of Leopold II and the death of Emperor Francis I.
sites.seasonal_notes: Visible year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit early for best photographs.

sites.name: Innsbruck Old Town (Altstadt)
sites.description: Medieval old town center with colorful buildings, narrow streets, charming squares, and historical landmarks including the Golden Roof.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round; Christmas markets in winter; less crowded in spring and fall.
sites.booking_tips: Consider a guided walking tour to learn about the history. Best explored on foot.

sites.name: Tirol Panorama Museum
sites.description: Museum featuring a stunning 360-degree panoramic painting depicting the Tyrolean battle for freedom against Napoleonic troops in 1809.
sites.seasonal_notes: Can be combined with Bergisel Ski Jump visit.
sites.booking_tips: Combined ticket available with Bergisel. Audio guides recommended.

sites.name: Imperial Palace (Kaiserliche Hofburg)
sites.description: Former Habsburg imperial palace featuring luxurious apartments, grand halls, and an impressive portrait gallery.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with seasonal exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Consider the combination ticket with other imperial attractions. Audio guides available.

sites.name: Patscherkofel Mountain
sites.description: Popular local mountain with hiking trails, ski slopes, and panoramic views of Innsbruck and the surrounding Alpine peaks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Winter for skiing; summer for hiking; autumn for fall colors.
sites.booking_tips: Take the cable car for easy access. Check weather conditions before visiting.

sites.name: Audioversum Sound Museum
sites.description: Interactive science center dedicated to the phenomenon of hearing, sound, and music with hands-on exhibits.
sites.seasonal_notes: Good for rainy days; suitable for families.
sites.booking_tips: Check for special workshops and interactive sessions.

sites.name: Tyrolean State Theatre (Tiroler Landestheater)
sites.description: Principal performing arts venue in Innsbruck offering opera, ballet, and theatrical performances in a historic setting.
sites.seasonal_notes: Season runs September through June.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance for popular performances. Check current program online.

sites.name: Bell Museum (Glockenmuseum)
sites.description: Unique museum in Grassmayr Bell Foundry showcasing the centuries-old tradition of bell casting with impressive historical exhibits.
sites.seasonal_notes: Special events during local festivals.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours available at specific times. Check for bell casting demonstrations.

sites.name: Botanical Garden Innsbruck
sites.description: University-managed gardens featuring alpine plants, tropical greenhouses, and diverse plant collections with mountain views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in late spring and summer for most blooms.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Check opening hours as they vary seasonally.

neighborhoods.name: Altstadt
neighborhoods.character: Historic and charming with cobblestone streets, the medieval heart of Innsbruck.

location.description: Heart of the city, centered around the Golden Roof.

history.overview: The oldest part of Innsbruck, developed in the Middle Ages.
history.significance: Historic center of trade and governance in Tyrol.

transit: Trams and buses accessible on surrounding streets (e.g., Marktgraben, Burggraben)
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Year-round; Summer for festivals, December for Christmas markets.

attractions.name: Golden Roof (Goldenes Dachl)
attractions.description: Iconic balcony with 2,738 fire-gilded copper tiles.
attractions.appeal: Symbol of Innsbruck, great photo opportunity.

attractions.name: Hofkirche (Court Church)
attractions.description: Gothic church housing Emperor Maximilian I's cenotaph.

attractions.name: Innsbruck Cathedral (Dom zu St. Jakob)
attractions.description: Stunning Baroque cathedral with elaborate interior.
attractions.appeal: Masterpiece of Baroque architecture and art.

activities.name: Climb the City Tower (Stadtturm)
activities.description: Ascend the medieval tower for panoramic views.

activities.name: Guided Walking Tour
activities.description: Learn about the history and legends of the Old Town.

stay_here_if: You want to be immersed in history and close to major attractions.
avoid_if: You prefer quieter areas, dislike tourist crowds, or need easy car access.
insider_tips: Explore the smaller side streets and alleyways for hidden architectural details.
Visit early in the morning or later in the evening to avoid the largest crowds.
Look up! Many buildings have beautiful oriel windows and facades.

neighborhoods.name: Innenstadt
neighborhoods.character: Vibrant and modern commercial heart with main shopping street and administrative buildings.

history.overview: Developed as the 'New Town' outside the medieval walls, becoming the main commercial and administrative hub.
history.significance: Main thoroughfare and center of modern Innsbruck life.
notable_events: Development of Maria-Theresien-Straße as a prestigious boulevard

transit: Numerous tram and bus lines converge here (e.g., Museumstraße, Anichstraße)
practical_info.safety: Very safe, busy day and night.

attractions.name: Maria-Theresien-Straße
attractions.description: Innsbruck's main boulevard with shops, cafes, and historic buildings.
attractions.appeal: Heart of the city, great for shopping and strolling.

attractions.name: Triumphal Arch (Triumphpforte)
attractions.description: Roman-style arch built by Empress Maria Theresa.

attractions.name: Audioversum
attractions.description: Interactive museum dedicated to hearing and sound.

activities.name: Shopping
activities.description: Browse department stores (Kaufhaus Tyrol, RathausGallerien) and boutiques.

activities.name: Café Hopping
activities.description: Relax at one of the many cafes lining Maria-Theresien-Straße.

stay_here_if: You love shopping, dining, and a lively, central atmosphere.
avoid_if: You prefer quieter, residential areas or are looking for budget options.
insider_tips: Check out the rooftop bar at The Penz Hotel for great views, even if not dining.
Explore the arcades and passages off the main street for smaller shops.
Enjoy the Christmas lights and markets here in December.

neighborhoods.name: Hötting
neighborhoods.character: Residential and peaceful hillside neighborhood with scenic views over the city and access to nature.

location.description: Northwest of the city center, on the sunny slopes north of the Inn river.

history.overview: One of the oldest settlements in the Innsbruck area, incorporated into the city in 1938.
history.significance: Retains some village character, known for its connection to nature and views.

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Spring, Summer, and Autumn for hiking and garden visits.
practical_info.walkability: Moderate, involves hills. Good for walks, less for quick errands.

attractions.name: Botanical Garden of the University of Innsbruck
attractions.description: Diverse collection of plants from around the world.

attractions.name: Höttinger Alm
attractions.description: Traditional Alm accessible via hike, offering food and views.

activities.name: Hiking
activities.description: Access trails leading up towards the Nordkette range.

activities.name: Nature Walks
activities.description: Enjoy walks through the quiet streets and nearby woods.

stay_here_if: You want a quiet, residential neighborhood with great views and easy access to nature/hiking.
avoid_if: You want immediate access to nightlife, extensive shopping, or dislike hills.
insider_tips: Take the 'J' bus line for easy access up the hill.
Wear comfortable shoes for walking the hilly streets.
Enjoy the sunset views over the city from higher points in the neighborhood.

neighborhoods.name: Saggen
neighborhoods.character: Elegant residential district known for its beautiful late 19th/early 20th-century villas and leafy streets.

location.description: Northeast of Innenstadt, stretching towards the Inn river.

history.overview: Developed primarily during the Gründerzeit period (late 19th century) as an upscale residential area.
history.significance: Showcases impressive villa architecture from various periods.
notable_events: Construction of numerous architecturally significant villas

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Year-round for architecture; Spring/Summer for pleasant walks.

best_for: Those seeking tranquility near the center

attractions.name: Villa Architecture
attractions.description: Numerous examples of historicist and Art Nouveau villas.

attractions.name: Hofgarten (Imperial Gardens)
attractions.description: Large park adjacent to Saggen, ideal for relaxing.
attractions.appeal: Green oasis near the city center.

activities.name: Architecture Walking Tour
activities.description: Stroll through the streets admiring the unique villas.

activities.name: Relax in the Hofgarten
activities.description: Enjoy the park's paths, playground, and cafes.

stay_here_if: You appreciate beautiful historic architecture and prefer quieter, upscale residential areas close to the center.
avoid_if: You want a wide variety of dining and nightlife options within the immediate neighborhood or are on a tight budget.
insider_tips: Simply wander the streets (like Kaiserjägerstraße, Falkstraße) to admire the villas.
Enjoy a coffee break at a cafe in the nearby Hofgarten.
It's a short, pleasant walk to the Old Town and city center.

neighborhoods.name: Pradl
neighborhoods.character: Diverse and bustling residential and commercial district east of the city center, with good infrastructure.

location.description: East of Innenstadt and the main railway line.

history.overview: Developed rapidly with the expansion of the railway, becoming a large residential and partly industrial area.
history.significance: Important residential area with significant sports and recreational facilities.
notable_events: Development of Olympiaworld for the Winter Olympics (1964, 1976)

practical_info.safety: Generally safe, standard urban residential area.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Year-round; check event schedules for Olympiaworld.
practical_info.walkability: Good within residential pockets and parks.

attractions.name: Rapoldi Park
attractions.description: Large urban park with playgrounds, paths, and a pond.

attractions.name: Olympiaworld Innsbruck
attractions.description: Complex hosting ice rinks, halls for sports, concerts, and events.
attractions.appeal: Major venue for sports and entertainment.

attractions.name: Tivoli Stadium
attractions.description: Home stadium for FC Wacker Innsbruck.

activities.name: Attend an Event at Olympiaworld
activities.description: Check the schedule for ice hockey, concerts, or other events.

activities.name: Relax in Rapoldi Park
activities.description: Enjoy walking, cycling, or relaxing in the park.

stay_here_if: You are looking for a more local residential experience with good transport links and parks.
avoid_if: You want to be in the heart of the historic or tourist center, seeking high-end dining/shopping.
insider_tips: Check out the local shops along Pradler Straße.
Rapoldi Park is great for a run or a family outing.
Look into public swimming options at the Olympiaworld complex.

neighborhoods.name: Wilten
neighborhoods.character: Artistic and vibrant district south of the center, known for its independent shops, cafés, and strong local community.

location.description: Southwest of Innenstadt, centered around Wiltener Platzl.

history.overview: One of Innsbruck's oldest areas, site of the Roman settlement Veldidena and the ancient Wilten Abbey.
history.significance: Important religious site (Abbey) and recently revitalized cultural and creative hub.
notable_events: Recent emergence as a trendy, artistic neighborhood

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Year-round; Fridays for the Wiltener Platzl market.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent, very pleasant for exploring on foot.

attractions.name: Basilica of Wilten
attractions.description: Magnificent Rococo basilica, parish church of Wilten.

attractions.name: Wilten Abbey (Stift Wilten)
attractions.description: Historic Premonstratensian monastery with a beautiful church.

attractions.name: Wiltener Platzl
attractions.description: Charming square hosting a popular weekly market.
attractions.appeal: Heart of the neighborhood, great atmosphere.

dining.name: Wilten Restaurants
dining.known_for: Diverse dining options, often with local/organic focus

activities.name: Browse Independent Shops
activities.description: Discover unique clothing, crafts, and design shops.

activities.name: Visit Wiltener Platzl Market
activities.description: Enjoy the Friday market with local produce, food stalls, and crafts.

activities.name: Explore Art Galleries
activities.description: Visit small galleries showcasing local and contemporary art.

stay_here_if: You enjoy artistic, vibrant neighborhoods with a strong local feel, independent shops, and good cafes.
avoid_if: You prefer very quiet areas or are looking for large chain stores/restaurants.
insider_tips: Definitely visit the market at Wiltener Platzl if you're there on a Friday.
Explore the side streets off Leopoldstraße for hidden gems.
Enjoy the relaxed pace and people-watching at a local café.

fine_dining.name: Schwarzer Adler
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book in advance, especially during weekends.
fine_dining.local_tips: Historic setting, consider trying a local wine.

fine_dining.name: Das Schindler
fine_dining.booking_tips: Great for a special occasion dinner.
fine_dining.local_tips: Has a popular bar area as well.

fine_dining.name: Penz Hotel Rooftop Restaurant
fine_dining.booking_tips: Visit at sunset for the best views.
fine_dining.local_tips: Excellent cocktail menu to enjoy with the view.

casual_dining.name: Stiftskeller
casual_dining.booking_tips: Can get busy during lunch hours.
casual_dining.local_tips: Perfect for a hearty lunch in the old town.

casual_dining.name: Gasthof Weisses Rössl
casual_dining.local_tips: Authentic Tyrolean experience in a historic building.

casual_dining.name: Buzihütte
casual_dining.booking_tips: Ideal for a meal after a hike.
casual_dining.local_tips: Requires a walk/hike to reach, check opening times.

casual_dining.name: Fischerhäusl
casual_dining.local_tips: Nice spot by the River Inn.

street_food.name: Innsbruck Food Market Stalls
street_food.local_tips: Visit on Saturdays for the full experience and farmer's market.

street_food.name: Baguette Food Truck
street_food.local_tips: Great option for a quick lunch, popular with students.

street_food.name: Adler Kebab
street_food.local_tips: Try the spicy sauce for an extra kick.

markets.name: Markthalle Innsbruck
markets.local_tips: Arrive early for the freshest selections, especially on Saturday.

markets.name: Wiltener Platzl Market
markets.local_tips: Combine your visit with exploring the charming Wilten district.

destinations.whyGo: Birthplace of Mozart and stunning alpine scenery

activities.name: Hiking in the Nordkette Mountains
activities.description: Explore the scenic trails of the Nordkette mountain range, which offer breathtaking views of Innsbruck and the surrounding Alps.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is ideal as the snow starts melting, revealing lush landscapes.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required, but check weather conditions before heading out.

activities.name: Ambras Castle Park
activities.description: Visit the beautiful gardens of Ambras Castle, which are in full bloom during spring.
activities.seasonal_notes: Enjoy the vibrant flora and fauna that spring brings.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed for the park, but entry fee applies for the castle.

activities.name: Easter Festival Tirol
activities.description: A cultural festival featuring classical music performances held annually during the Easter period.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect for experiencing local culture in spring.
activities.booking_tips: Advance booking is recommended due to high demand.

activities.name: Innsbruck Summer Music Festival
activities.description: Celebrate summer with a series of concerts featuring international and local artists.
activities.seasonal_notes: Enjoy long summer evenings with live music.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance as events often sell out.

activities.name: Swimming in Natterer See
activities.description: Cool off in the crystal-clear waters of Natterer See, a popular swimming spot near Innsbruck.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect escape from the summer heat.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early to secure a good spot by the lake.

activities.name: Harvest Festival
activities.description: Celebrate the harvest season with traditional food, music, and customs.
activities.seasonal_notes: Enjoy the local culture and cuisine during the harvest period.
activities.booking_tips: Check the local calendar for specific dates and locations.

activities.name: Alpenzoo Innsbruck
activities.description: Visit the Alpenzoo, home to a wide range of alpine animals, as they prepare for winter.
activities.seasonal_notes: Cooler autumn days make it perfect for a zoo visit.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online or at the entrance.

activities.name: Skiing in the Stubai Valley
activities.description: Experience world-class skiing and snowboarding at the Stubai Glacier, one of Austria's premier ski destinations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is peak season for skiing in this region.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodation and lift passes in advance to secure the best deals.

activities.name: Innsbruck Christmas Market
activities.description: Enjoy festive shopping, local crafts, and traditional Austrian treats at the Christmas markets in Innsbruck.
activities.seasonal_notes: A must-visit for experiencing holiday cheer and local traditions.
activities.booking_tips: Visit during weekdays to avoid larger crowds.

ranges.notes: Public holiday. Many businesses closed. Ski resorts open. Potential for Four Hills Tournament events early in the month.
Peak winter sports season. Cold temperatures, good snow conditions likely in surrounding resorts. Fewer city tourists but ski areas are busy.
Continued peak ski season. Often good snow conditions. City itself remains relatively quiet compared to summer. Carnival (Fasching) events may occur.
End of main ski season, possibility of spring skiing at higher altitudes (e.g., Stubai). Temperatures start to rise in the valley. City starts to awaken.

ranges.event: Easter Festival Tirol (if Easter falls in March)
ranges.notes: Classical music festival around Easter. Easter markets may start appearing towards the end of the month.

ranges.event: Easter Festival Tirol & Easter Markets (if Easter falls in April)
ranges.notes: Spring arrives in the valley. Hiking possible at lower elevations. Gardens like Ambras Castle Park start blooming. Easter markets add charm.
Public holiday. Pleasant spring weather, ideal for city exploration and lower-altitude hikes.
Excellent month for hiking as higher trails open. Gardens are beautiful. Outdoor cafes are popular. Comfortable temperatures.

ranges.event: Start of Summer Festivals (e.g., Innsbruck Festival of Early Music prep)
ranges.notes: Warm weather, long daylight hours. Ideal for hiking, mountain biking, visiting lakes (e.g., Natterer See). Start of summer festival season.

ranges.event: Innsbruck Festival of Early Music, Promenade Concerts
ranges.notes: Peak summer. Warmest month, can be hot. Popular time for hiking and outdoor activities. Main summer festivals underway. City can be crowded.

ranges.event: Innsbruck Festival of Early Music continues
ranges.notes: High summer season continues. Warm weather, ideal for mountains and lakes. Busy with tourists.
Public holiday. Peak summer tourism.
Late summer. Weather still generally warm. Good for outdoor activities. Crowds may start to lessen slightly towards the end.

ranges.event: Almabtrieb (Cattle Drives) in nearby villages, Harvest Festivals
ranges.notes: Often beautiful sunny days with cooler evenings. Excellent hiking weather. Start of autumn colours. Traditional Almabtrieb events in surrounding areas.
Autumn colours peak. Cooler temperatures. Good time for city sightseeing, museums (e.g., Tyrolean State Museum), and lower elevation walks. Alpenzoo visit is pleasant.
Public holiday. Special events may occur. Good time for cultural activities.
Late autumn. Days get shorter. Prepare for potentially colder, wetter weather.
Public holiday. Quiet time in the city. Some businesses closed.
Transition to winter. Colder, often grey. Fewer tourists. Good for museums and indoor activities. Ski resorts prepare to open.
Innsbruck's charming Christmas markets (Altstadt, Maria-Theresien-Straße, Marktplatz, Hungerburg) begin opening, bringing festive atmosphere.
Magical atmosphere with Christmas markets in full swing. Potential for Krampus runs early in the month. Ski season starts.
Public holiday. Christmas markets are very popular.
Very festive period. Book accommodation well in advance. Ski resorts operational.
Public holidays. Most shops, restaurants, and markets closed or have limited hours. Quiet family time.
Inter-holiday period. Ski resorts busy. Some tourists visiting.
Celebrations in the city, often fireworks over the Nordkette (check specific year's plan). Lively atmosphere.

spring: Hiking on lower Nordkette trails as snow melts
Exploring the Altstadt (Old Town) with fewer crowds
Easter Markets and Easter Festival Tirol
Visiting museums (Tyrolean State Museum, Golden Roof Museum)
summer: Hiking and mountain biking in the surrounding Alps (Nordkette, Patscherkofel)
Swimming in nearby lakes (Natterer See, Lanser See)
Attending summer music festivals and promenade concerts
Taking the Nordkette cable car for panoramic views
Exploring the Old Town and Maria-Theresien-Straße
autumn: Attending harvest festivals in the region
winter: Skiing and snowboarding in nearby resorts (Nordkette, Patscherkofel, Axamer Lizum, Stubai)
Taking the Nordkette cable car for winter views
Visiting museums and indoor attractions (Swarovski Crystal Worlds nearby)
Enjoying traditional Tyrolean food in cozy restaurants

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Generally unfavorable conditions for typical tourism (rarely applicable)
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, potential for closures (holidays), excessive heat or cold/wet weather
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, potential for cold/snow (winter) or heat/crowds (summer), moderate tourism or holiday peaks
scoreDescription.4: Good: Favorable conditions, good weather, possibly some key events, manageable or festive crowds
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Ideal conditions, significant positive events, pleasant weather, potentially moderate crowds
